job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: IntroductionIllumina’s Clinical Bioinformatics group are looking for an enthusiastic and highly numerate data scientist to join their team based in San Diego, CA to support the development of new Illumina products and help maintain on-market solutions.Members of the team collaborate closely with lab scientists to support assay development and with software engineers to support software development. The team is responsible for experimental design, data management, data analysis, algorithm development and bioinformatics software development. The ideal candidate will be able to work in a cross-functional team, translating the challenges faced by the group into bioinformatics solutions.Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited ToBuild robust pipelines and ad-hoc scripts to analyze massively parallel sequencing (NGS) genomic data and organize the results to enable further analysisWrite production-quality implementations of bioinformatic tools and machine learning algorithms for inclusion in Illumina’s DRAGEN Bio-IT softwareSupport the assay development team with experimental design and data analysisDevelop novel and optimize existing algorithms to improve product performance and patient outcomesRegular communication of analysis results and other findings to a cross-functional teamProduce documentation of data analyses, custom software tools or software development activities to meet the requirements of IVD product developmentSkills and experienceRequiredPhD (or Master’s degree with more than 5 years of industry experience) in Statistics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computer Science or a related fieldDemonstrated experience with statistical and mathematical modelling of large-scale datasets, using a distributed computing environmentDemonstrated experience with machine learning techniques, Bayesian statistics and multivariate analysisDemonstrated participation in highly collaborative efforts with research scientists and engineersExpert in R at the level of: authorship of R-specific articles / presentations at specialized conferences / authorship and maintenance of a CRAN package / showcase of R Shiny apps / data science blogs with high page rankMust have very strong written, communication and presentation skills, with the ability to present to both scientific and corporate audiencesDesirableProficiency with tidyverse, Bioconductor, Jupyter notebooksExperience with version control systems (e.g., GitHub)Experience with SGE strongly preferred. Experience with other job managers (Torque/PBS/LSF) is acceptableExperience working with NGS data or other genetic informationAt Illumina, we strive to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace by cultivating an environment in which everyone contributes to our mission. Built on a strong foundation, Illumina has always been rooted in openness, collaboration, and seeking alternative views and perspectives to propel innovation in genomics. We are proud to confirm a zero-net gap in pay, regardless of gender, ethnicity, or race.
